docs.snippet: These bots are generally powered by artificial intelligence software that allows them to pull in data and turn it into comprehensible answers.

headline.print_headline: Banks Bet Financial Bots Are the Next Big Thing
headline.main: Banks Bet on the Next Big Thing: Financial Chatbots

docs.abstract: Several banks, including Bank of America and MasterCard, announce they will be using chatbots, artificial intelligence-powered tools that pull in data to answer consumers' questions about financial accounts, implement transactions and provide financial advice; many predict automated bots are wave of future in banking industry.

docs.snippet: A police officer has died after being shot in the head when he and two others working security at the Rio Olympics got lost near a slum and encountered gunfire.

headline.print_headline: Olympic Officer Who Was Shot After Wrong Turn Into Slum Dies
headline.main: Olympic Officer Who Was Shot After Wrong Turn Into Slum Dies

docs.snippet: The sharing economy isn’t really about sharing. So what do we call it?
Vietnam has declared a U.S.-based activist group a terrorist organization and warned that any Vietnamese found to be involved with the group would be regarded as co-conspirators and punished.
The daughter of former President Ronald Reagan has a message for Donald Trump: "Words matter."

headline.print_headline: Reagan Daughter Patti Davis Tells Trump: 'Words Matter'
headline.main: Reagan Daughter Patti Davis Tells Trump: 'Words Matter'

docs.snippet: Actress Sagan Lewis, who was best known for her work on the 1980s NBC medical drama "St. Elsewhere," has died following a long battle with cancer. She was 63.

headline.print_headline: 'St. Elsewhere' Actress Sagan Lewis Dies at 63
headline.main: 'St. Elsewhere' Actress Sagan Lewis Dies at 63

docs.snippet: The singer and songwriter reads an essay about how new love is young, even after 80.

headline.main: The Modern Love Podcast: Mary Chapin Carpenter Reads ‘The Race Grows Sweeter Near Its Final Lap’

docs.snippet: Dozens of female employees arrived at the Knesset in above-the-knee outfits to protest what they said was a sudden shift in enforcing a longstanding dress code.

headline.print_headline: In Israel, Parliament Draws a Line on Hemlines
headline.main: Israel’s Parliament Draws a Line on Short Hemlines

docs.abstract: Dozens of female employees at Israeli Knesset attend work in skirts that end above their knees; move is intended to protest renewed efforts by parliamentary body's guards to enforce longstanding dress code requiring dignified dress; women compare enforcers of code to modesty police in conservative religious societies.

docs.snippet: An Algerian appeals court has upheld a two-year prison sentence against London-based journalist Mohamed Tamalt for insulting President Abdelaziz Bouteflika on his Facebook page.

headline.print_headline: Algerian Court Upholds 2-Year Term Against Journalist
headline.main: Algerian Court Upholds 2-Year Term Against Journalist

docs.snippet: The producer of “All Def Comedy” and “Def Comedy Jam” talks about the shows and about how he hopes to bring new talent to the public.

headline.print_headline: For Black Comedians, It’s ‘Hollywood So White’
headline.main: Russell Simmons: For Black Comedians, It’s ‘Hollywood So White’
